alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:30PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central San Diego County through 415 PM PDT... At 329 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hwy 78 Between Banner and S2, moving east at 20 mph just east of Julian. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Julian, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, northern Mount Laguna, Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna, Hwy 79 Between Julian And Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78, Banner, Shelter Valley and Santa Ysabel Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Mountains
